definition: four horse military chariot (archaic)/four (archaic)/generic term for history books
to ride/to mount/to make use of/to avail oneself of/to take advantage of/to multiply (math.)/Buddhist sect or creed
plain/informal/suitable/convenient/opportune/to urinate or defecate/equivalent to 就[jiu4]: then/in that case/even if/soon afterwards
(idiom) to rely on the most favorable method

sentences.english: Shengbian whether to take her mother to go home, see?
sentences.chinese: 是否乘便帶她回家見媽媽？

sentences.english: Shall we drop in on John?
sentences.chinese: 我們乘便造訪一下約翰嗎？

sentences.english: Please bring me the book whenever it's convenient.
sentences.chinese: 請你乘便把那本書帶給我。

sentences.english: He stopped his car to pick up a young girl who was hitch-hiking across Europe.
sentences.chinese: 他停車搭載一個乘便車旅行歐洲的年輕女孩。

definition: variant of 伺機|伺机[si4 ji1]
confidential aspects of a matter/secrets/key moment for action
to seize an opportunity/to exploit (a loophole)
(idiom) to rely on the most favorable method
to take the opportunity/to take a plane
variant of 倉促|仓促[cang1 cu4]
